entry.title: Re: How to enable caching for SAP OData V2?
entry.content:
I am on ABAP >=7.52, but it don't see how the class can be used without major adaptation.

  1. Cache support class doesn't affect building of cache keys at all
  2. /ui2/if_cache_support_2=>invalidate_cache is called, but only provided entity_set name - this is not enough to rebuild the cache key for the current request, so how can this even be used?
  3. /ui2/cl_cache_handler=>get is called with "expiry_secs". If this was customizable, it would work great! But it is hardcoded as -1..

Thus, I don't see any way to customize caching behaviour of this class without reimplementation as of now, which is a shame, because it looks like a nice utility for caching that is just missing some places to hook in custom behaviour (e.g. via cache support class construct, imagine if we had all params to determine expiry_secs dynamically here..). Maybe I am missing something or this class is not intended the way I want to use it, best regards

entry.title: How to update or maintain Multilingual Text for Equipment's/Functional Location in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
In SAP S4 Hana Public Cloud there is no app or transaction called Create/Change Equipment and Create/Change Functional Location, instead there is Create/Change Technical objects which support both equipment and Functional Location. However unlikely in SAP S4 Hana Public Cloud there is also no option for maintaining or changing the multilingual texts. 

But when doing the initial load through LTMC migration cockpit there is option to add languages.

Can anyone help to understand how to achieve this when creating manually or for updating.

entry.title: Re: BW/4 Inplace Conversion - Precheck warning - Query wi...
entry.content:
Hi,

The switch to B4H, R4C will be possible, even the technical conversion to SAP BW/4HANA, but you have to consider that the logic of the variables (SAP Exit) will either not be available or work differently.

Check the following SAP Notes:

  • SAP Note 2673734 - BW4SL - BI Content
  • SAP Note 2851061 - New BEx variables for simplification of conversion to SAP BW/4HANA
  • SAP Note 2857063 - BI_CONT: New BEx Variables to simplify conversion from SAP BW to SAP BW/4HANA
  • SAP Note 3301981 - Function Modules for SAP Exit Variables part of BI_CONT included with BW4CONT 200 SP13

Best Regards,

Eduard

entry.title: Re: How do I reverse MM Period Close in S4 HANA
entry.content:
Hello @goody-1 

That can't be done within standard. The only method I am aware of is direct modification of MARV and CKMLKEV tables content. Here is how - SAP MM Period Opening Withdrawal

That is not a best practice, it is very risky and it will not be supported by SAP if anything goes south. Proceed at your own risk. You have been warned.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Datasphere backup
entry.content:
You can't.
Backups are intended for disaster recovery and are managed internally by SAP.
There is no option for selective restores on demand.

Regards,
XP

entry.title: Re: Revenue posting for Usage based billing
entry.content:
Hello @sheetalsethiya22 

Revenue is not posted immediately upon creating the usage-based billing document. Instead, it is processed through Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR). You should run the EBRR job and review the postings in Display Journal Entries to verify.

SAP Help Event-Based Revenue Recognition - Projects

SAP Best Practice 1A8 – Project Billing (Usage-Based & Time & Expense)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Mass activation of ICF services
entry.content:
Disclaimer: that's a copy of the below blog post, not authored by me, because the original formatting has a blank page and screenshots are truncated:

Mass activation of Service ICF - SAP Community.

All credits go to the original author.

<START>

SAP Basis Administrator always face problem in activating ICF services in mass and in sync with other systems in the landscape, mostly after a new system build or new installation or sometime after system refreshed / client copy as well. This is a general problem and always trouble a lot. Normally we do it manually which takes a lot of time. Here is my blog which will help you to overcome this problem and allow you to activate/deactivate ICF services in mass which will take hardly 2 minutes to perform the task. Though the verification is always recommended.

SAP provides two reports RS_ICF_SERV_ADMIN_TASKS (export to CSV) and RS_ICF_SERV_MASS_PROCESSING (import from CSV) which does all the tricks for us. However, it is important to note how to use these reports. Importantly the second one otherwise you might mess up the system by deactivating all the services at once. Below you will find step by step pictorial blog to make your work easy.

So let's start.

Execute SA38 or SE38 and provide report name RS_ICF_SERV_ADMIN_TASKS

 


Select option export active services to CSV file

 

Provide file location and file name

 

File will be created at specified location. File format will be CSV

 

All active services exported inside excel sheet

 

Deactivated services in target system

 

CSV file having these services

 

Execute SA38 and provide report name RS_ICF_SERV_MASS_PROCESSING

 

Select the option as shown in the picture and execute

 

Select Yes

 

Upload the file and execute

 

Result of successful activation

 

All services in the CSV file will be activated in target system

 


Conclusion:

By performing these activities, it will make Basis administration task of activating SICF will easy and save lots of time for them. Normally, activating services manually takes hours, however, doing this way it will take a few minutes to perform the same task.

THE END

Disclaimer: that's a copy of the below blog post, not authored by me, because the original formatting has a blank page and screenshots are truncated:

Mass activation of Service ICF - SAP Community.

All credits go to the original author.

NB: for information, in ABAP 7.58, the screens have changed a little bit:

I am investigating the reason of these error messages...

entry.title: Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP community enthusiasts! 

 Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge and experiences with fellow tech-savvy individuals attending SAP TechEd on Tour? Do you have innovative ideas or insights into SAP technologies that you think could benefit others? If so, here's an exciting opportunity for you to shine!  

We are offering Community Talks, which are 20-minutes session slots, to be filled by community members to share their knowledge with the community onsite at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore. Sign up as Community Talk speaker for our much-anticipated event taking place on November 25-26, 2025! 

As a Community Talk Speaker you’ll get a “Lecture-Only” ticket to attend SAP TechEd. Travel and Expenses are not covered by SAP.

Why Participate as a Community Talk Speaker? 

As a speaker at SAP TechEd, you'll be at the forefront of inspiring and engaging with technical professionals, developers, and business leaders. It's a unique opportunity to: 

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Share your unique insights, experiences, and innovations with a diverse audience. Hands-on, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  • Network and Collaborate: Connect with other SAP professionals, enthusiasts, and thought leaders from around the globe in the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore. 
  • Expand Your Reach: Gain visibility in the SAP ecosystem and establish yourself as a go-to expert in your field. 

Topics to Consider 

We're looking for presentations on a wide range of topics that resonate with SAP TechEd's core focus areas. There are nine content tracks, please have a look at all of them on the SAP TechEd Event Website. These include (but are not limited to): 

  • Application Development and Automation 
  • Business Transformation Management 
  • AI and machine learning applications in SAP such as Business AI and Joule 
  • Breakthroughs in data management and analytics 
  • Integration 
  • Cloud Applications  

If you have a creative idea that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with SAP, we'd love to hear about it! 

Important Dates and Deadlines: 

To ensure you don't miss out, please keep an eye on the following important dates: 

  • Deadline for Speaker Applications and your Session Submissions: October 10, 2025 
  • Notification of Acceptance: October 17, 2025 
  • Final Presentation Submission for review: November 10, 2025 (if you don’t intend to have a presentation for your session, even better!) 
  • Date of the event: November 25-26, 2025 (ensure to be available on both days until the Community Talks schedule is finalized) 

How to Apply 

Think you're ready to take the stage? Here’s how you can apply: 

  1. Prepare Your Proposal: Outline the main points and objectives of your talk. Make sure it aligns with this year’s focus areas (see SAP TechEd Event Website for content tracks) and is tech-content (it should not be marketing products, services or companies).  Again, hands-on-style, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  2. Submit Your Application: Write an email to us and complete the email with all session details. Use this mailto link as it is prepared with all details for your convenience.  
  3. Document Your Passion: Highlight your enthusiasm and experience with SAP solutions—include any previous speaking engagements or relevant achievements. You’re very welcome to share an abstract of your session here in community.sap.com and gain feedback and reputation as a fellow community member.  

Join us in Bangalore! 

Let's make this year's conference inspirational and groundbreaking together. We can’t wait to hear your stories, ideas, and innovations. Join us and become an integral part of the SAP Community! 

Feel free to share this opportunity with your colleagues and networks who may be interested in speaking or attending. Together, let’s continue to push the boundaries of technology and innovation. 

We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!

entry.title: Re: Issue Connecting Power BI to SAP CDS View via OData Feed
entry.content:
Hi @taher123 ,

The Power BI error message basically means the OData feed from SAP isn’t authenticating with the credentials you’re giving it.
Here’s how to troubleshoot and what you can reply on the forum:

Likely Causes

  1. Anonymous Access Blocked:
    SAP OData services (especially CDS-based) don’t allow anonymous access by default. Power BI is trying with “Anonymous” mode.

  2. Wrong Authentication Method in Power BI:
    You need to use either Basic (username/password) or Organizational Account (SAML/SSO) depending on how your Gateway is configured.

  3. No HTTPS / Self-Signed Certificate Issue:
    Your URL is using HTTP on port 18020. Power BI may reject or require manual approval for an untrusted endpoint. So try https host. Check with your SAP BASIS team to get the correct https URL.

  4. Missing CORS or Network Reachability:
    Power BI desktop must reach your SAP Gateway host and port. Check firewall / VPN access. Check this with your SAP and network team.

    Regards,
    Sudheer.

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE… and what it is not !
entry.content:
Hello Max
yes there is a lot of experience already with RISE migrations for BW-systems. The duration can be quite fast starting from the point when commercial/contractual discussions are over. The pure migration for 3 tiers can be done in one quarter, depending on resource availability, testing effort, business requirements etc. There is no change stop, you can transport changes from BW PCE (Dev) to BW on Prem (QA/Prod).
For the transfer to BDC serious estimation is  impossible without detailed analysis of status quo.
One way forward here would be this assessment offered by SAP.
KR Frank

entry.title: Re: How to make visible customer data item level tab for...
entry.content:
You need to implement OSS Note 3307066.

TADIR Entry Object Description
R3TR - FUGR - MEGUI LIMU - REPS - LMEGUICIY

*$*$----------------------------------------------------------------$*$*
*$ Correction Inst.         0020751259 0001573021                     $*
*$--------------------------------------------------------------------$*
*$ Valid for       :                                                  $*
*$ Software Component   S4CORE                                        $*
*$  Release 108          All Support Package Levels                   $*
*$*$----------------------------------------------------------------$*$*
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Object          REPS LMEGUICIY
*& Object Header   FUGR MEGUI
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& CLASS LCL_CUST_ITEM_VIEW_MM IMPLEMENTATION
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------*
...
      CALL METHOD lo_item->get_data
        IMPORTING
          ex_data = ls_mepoitem.

      IF ls_mepoitem-pstyp = cl_mmpur_constants=>pstyp_a. "S/4 LIMIT
*>>>> START OF DELETION <<<<<
        CALL METHOD deactivate.
*>>>> END OF DELETION <<<<<<<
*>>>> START OF INSERTION <<<<
*        CALL METHOD deactivate.                          " 3307066
*>>>> END OF INSERTION <<<<<<
...
*&-------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Re: BW/4 Inplace Conversion - Precheck warning - Query wi...
entry.content:
Hi Axel,
I agree to Eduard. We recommend to adjust the queries beforehand: Either delete them as they are obsolete (fastest approach) or correct them before B4H mode. Expectation is that all objects are working properly when the system is technically converted to BW/4HANA: For that reason, many BEx variables that were integrated for the first time in SAP BW/4HANA are have been delivered with SAP BW as well. This allows you to adjust your queries beforehand.
KR Frank

entry.title: Re: API for retrieving GL account master data
entry.content:
Hello @yahaha 

Thank you for your question. You are not limited to using the API API_GLACCOUNTINCHARTOFACCOUNTS_SRV to access G/L account master data. There are other supported options available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud SAP Help-APIs for General Ledger Accounting. SAP Help-APIs for General Ledger Accounting

You can use Fiori App Export

In the app Manage G/L Account Master Data, you can filter accounts and use the Export to Spreadsheet function. SAP Help – Manage G/L Account Master Data

You may also want to synchronise the G/L Account Master Data App to ensure system alignment between tenants. It also helps maintain Quality and Production consistency and checks availability across systems. SAP Help – Synchronise G/L Account Master Data

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: BTP-App to Speed up ALM Operations
entry.content:
Challenges in the Systemoverview for Operation

If you do a monitoring of your Systems on a daily basis, it takes it time to get to the relevant information from CALM.

For our operations team in daily business—and for customers who carry out monitoring independently—two problems arise: 

Firstly, to get an overview of the system status, at least 3–4 use cases such as “Exception Monitoring,” “Real User Monitoring,” and “Health Monitoring” must be analysed. This is a time factor for the support team to start various UIs and analyse the data. Having many environments for various customers, it is crucial that employees do not lose track of which systems are critical and production-relevant. 

Secondly, the information about which system belongs to which environment (Prod, QA and Dev) is missing. This information is not directly visible on the tiles displayed in SAP CALM. Grouping systems by environment and freely assigning system names—which would improve clarity—cannot be configured. This means that an additional documentation of the respective system landscape is still required. 

Our Solution

Based on the Cloud ALM API, we have developed a BTP application , which addresses these challenges and enriches the solution with additional features such as AI support. 

When you start using this App, you initially have to load once the systems from Landscape Management via the CALM API into a configuration dashboard. Here, the following information can be added to the systems: 

  • Assigning a system to a environment (may be differen from the given role) 
  • Giving a meaningful name 
  • Activate for display the system in the dashboard

This configuration is stored persistently in a database. 

Configuration screen

The main page of the BTP app consists of one tile per system environment. Here, the results for the configured use cases of the systems are displayed. 

If a maintenance window is scheduled for a system in this environment within the next 7 days, it will also be shown. 

Through the integration of an AI solution, it is possible to derive recommended actions by comparing the current status of the use cases with a previous point in time. 

As an additional piece of information, the number of open alerts is also displayed. 

Main Dashborad

On the detail page of a system environment, the detailed figures for the use cases of each configured system are displayed. 
If further investigation of the alerts is required, users can directly jump into the respective system from this view.

Detail Page

Outlook 

Further goals for future implementation phases include, for example: 

  • Integration of systems that are not yet connectable out-of-the-box to SAP CALM, such as SAP Commerce Cloud 
  • Monitoring of third-party systems via an API 

The API is intended not only to check availability, but also to verify whether the retrieved results match the given inputs. 

Conclusion

With this solution, the operations team should be able to quickly and reliably gain an overview of the customer’s system status. The BTP App enables operations teams to quickly access system health, track maintenance schedules, and respond to alerts efficiently. 

Please add you Ideas or ask questions
Regards
Ingo Schröder
Sybit GmbH, NTT DATA Business Solutions

entry.title: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product – Dependent Access Query
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have two public dimensions Profit Center and Product added both as a story filter and enabled Data Access Control for the Profit Center dimension, giving access based on their Business Area say (A, B, C, D, E) and user access is set so they only see profit centers linked to their Business Area.

Current behavior:
Users see only the profit centers they’re permitted to access. However, our goal is for users to select a profit center and then have the Product filter dynamically show only the products associated with that profit center rather than displaying all products.

for example, suppose a user in Business Area 'B' sees only “Ducati” as their profit center. When they choose Ducati, the Product filter should then only offer options like “Panigale V4” and “Monster,” which are explicitly linked to Ducati, instead of showing products linked to other profit centers.

So, to achieve should we enable Data Access Control for the Product dimension as well, so users see only products related to their assigned profit centers? Or is there a more efficient way to implement linked filters using standard SAC functionality, without relying on JavaScript?

Thanks.

entry.title: MDK App Crash on Low Version Android Devices – API Level 35 Build
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’ve encountered an issue where the MDK app built with Android API level 35 is crashing on devices running lower Android versions. The crash seems to occur during app launch or initial interaction and is likely due to compatibility constraints introduced in the newer API level.

Key Observations:

  • Crash reported on devices running Android 8, 9, 10 and 11.
  • App built and deployed using MDK with target API 35.
  • No issues observed on Android 12 and above.

If anyone has faced this issue or found a workaround, please share your insights. Your input would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Joule Based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant
entry.content:
Introduction

Migrating legacy SAP HANA applications can be a complex and time-consuming process. The Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a new extension for SAP Business Application Studio that streamlines this journey by leveraging generative AI to automate key migration tasks. This tool is designed to help developers and organizations transition from older architectures like XS Classic and XS Advanced to the modern, cloud-native SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) on SAP HANA Cloud.

Motivation:

Moving away from legacy HANA applications isn't just a technical exercise; it's a strategic move. By migrating to a CAP-based architecture on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), you can:

  • Boost Innovation and Agility: CAP’s modular framework allows you to develop new features and services faster, responding to market demands with unprecedented speed.

  • Reduce Total Cost of Ownership (TCO): Cloud-native architectures are often more cost-effective to operate and maintain, allowing you to reallocate resources to innovation.

  • Future-Proof Your Applications: Aligning with SAP's strategic "clean core" vision ensures your applications remain relevant, scalable, and ready to leverage future SAP innovations.

  • Enhance Scalability and Resiliency: SAP HANA Cloud and the BTP offer a robust, secure, and highly available environment for your critical business applications.

Value for End Users

The primary value of this assistant for end users is the significant reduction in manual effort and migration time. By automating the conversion of database and service layer artifacts, the tool allows developers to focus on higher-value tasks, such as validating business logic and refining the migrated application. This acceleration empowers businesses to modernize their applications faster, reduce technical debt, and more quickly realize the benefits of a cloud-native architecture.

Architectural Shift

The assistant facilitates a fundamental architectural shift from a monolithic, on-premise application structure to a modular, cloud-based one. The migration targets the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), which provides a robust framework for building enterprise applications on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). This new architecture promotes a clean core strategy, where custom logic is developed as side-by-side extensions, ensuring that the core SAP system remains standard and easy to upgrade.

Time and Knowledge Required

While the assistant automates a large part of the conversion, it's important to set proper expectations. The tool is a powerful accelerator, but human intervention is still required post-migration to validate, refine, and productionize the application logic. The generated code includes comments that link back to the original source, making it easier for developers to verify that the key business logic has been accurately transformed. Users should have a foundational understanding of the target architecture (SAP CAP) and the source system (XS Classic or XS Advanced) to effectively use the assistant and complete the migration.

AI Value for the Service Layer:

The standout feature of this assistant is its use of generative AI for migrating the service layer. The assistant analyzes legacy artifacts such as .xsodata, .xsjslib, and .xsjs files. It then uses GenAI capabilities in SAP Build Code to generate corresponding CAP service definitions (service.cds, service.js) and custom handler implementations. This AI-powered conversion is particularly valuable because it accelerates the migration of service logic while preserving the original structure and functional behavior where possible.

How to Get Started:

To get started, developers need to have an SAP Business Application Studio dev space with the SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant extension installed. The migration process generally involves these steps:

  1. Set up the necessary connections to the source database using the SAP Cloud Connector.

  2. Open the Migration Assistant Wizard from the Command Palette in SAP Business Application Studio.

  3. Select the migration path (e.g., XSC to CAP or XSA to CAP).

  4. Specify the source project and the target directory for the new CAP application.

  5. Choose to convert the service layer using the GenAI capabilities.

For detailed, step-by-step guides, you can refer to the following documentation:

  • SAP-samples/xsc-cap-migration 

A Deeper Look: What the Assistant Actually Does

The true power of the migration assistant is best seen in the code itself. While the legacy code (XS Classic/Advanced) was tightly coupled to the HANA database, the modern CAP model separates concerns, making the application easier to read, maintain, and scale.

Before: The Legacy Service Layer

This example shows a typical .xsodata file used to expose a service in the legacy XS Classic/Advanced world. It's a declarative way to create an OData endpoint directly from a database view or table.

After: The CAP Service Layer

This is the equivalent CAP service, generated by the assistant. It uses .cds for the service definition, which provides a richer, more powerful data modeling language, and a separate JavaScript file (.js) for any custom logic, promoting a cleaner separation of concerns.

For an even deeper dive into the tool's inner workings and a guided walkthrough, a great resource is the official SAP Community blog bykesavan_s : Joule based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI

Post-Migration Steps: Your Role in the Final Phase

The migration assistant provides a powerful head start, but the journey to a production-ready application requires crucial post-migration steps. Think of this phase as the final seal of quality where you ensure everything is robust and aligned with your business needs.

The migration assistant doesn't just convert code; it provides a comprehensive Migration Report to guide your next steps. This report is your single source of truth, detailing the overall migration status and specific results for each converted artifact. Most importantly, it includes a clear list of post-migration steps tailored for both the database and service layers, giving you a structured roadmap to finalize your application.

 

The Outlook - What's Next for the Migration Assistant: 

The introduction of the Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a significant step, and there are more enhancements on the horizon. The future outlook for this tool points towards an even more refined and flexible migration experience.

Planned enhancements scheduled before Q3 2025 include:

  • HANA Native Object Migration to HANA Cloud: This new feature will streamline the process of migrating core HANA native database objects directly to SAP HANA Cloud, ensuring a more direct and efficient transition of your data assets.
  • Staged Migration for XSC to CAP: This will enable a more controlled, incremental approach to migrating your XS Classic applications. Instead of a "big bang" conversion, you'll be able to migrate your application in phases, allowing for easier testing, validation, and a lower-risk transition.

These planned features show a clear roadmap focused on providing developers with greater control, flexibility, and efficiency in their modernization journey.

Conclusion:

The Joule-based SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is a powerful tool that makes moving your legacy apps to the cloud much easier. By automating the tricky parts with AI, it frees you up to focus on what matters most: building great applications. This tool is a key part of SAP's vision for a modern, side-by-side development future, and it's ready to help you get there.

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
@ChrisVC 

I am not sure if this will work with Datasphere source. But in SAC stories there is Business Calculation formula called SMA.

SMA([<measure>],[d/<date dimension>], "<time granularity>", <period>)

7_SMA = SMA([Quantity],[d/Date],"Month",7)  - This is sum of last 7 periods / 7

Now if you just multiply this back by period it will give you the Sum over that period.

7_SUM = SMA([Quantity],[d/Date],"Month",7) * 7

Refer to the help docs here.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/3b7c99a7a7cd4a29bb1c5132d91af341.html#business-functions

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: When using xco libraries I obtain the error message "PUT operation failed"
entry.content:
When developing a helper class to solve a customer problem I used the xco libraries to generate several packages.  

The creation of the packages initially failed and in the try catch block I only received the error message 

"PUT operation failed"

TRY.
        DATA(lo_specification) = put_operation->add_object( i_package_name )->create_form_specification( ).
        lo_specification->set_short_description( short_description ).
        lo_specification->properties->set_super_package( i_super_package_name )->set_software_component( co_dmo_sap_package ).
        DATA(lo_result) = put_operation->execute( ).
        " handle findings
        DATA(lo_findings) = lo_result->findings.
        findings = lo_findings->get( ).
      CATCH cx_root  INTO DATA(generation_exception).
        exception_text = generation_exception->get_text(  ).
ENDTRY.

 So how I am able to find out the root cause?

entry.title: Re: When using xco libraries I obtain the error message "...
entry.content:
The solution is to catch not cx_root but the exception cx_xco_gen_put_exception as described in the online help

 

CATCH cx_xco_gen_put_exception INTO DATA(generation_exception).
exception_text = generation_exception->get_text( ).
findings = generation_exception->findings->get( ).
messages = generation_exception->if_xco_news~get_messages( ).
ENDTRY.

https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/sap-business-technology-platform/generation-error-handling

entry.title: Re: Maintain/Update Multilingual Texts in Equipment/Funct...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility: Change Technical Object for more details.

To summarise, currently you cannot use the Create/Change Technical Object app in the public cloud to maintain multilingual descriptions directly in the UI.

However, you have two options to achieve that goal:

First is to switch you Logon language in Fiori and update the description in each language. The system stores each text version separately.

Secondly, use the Migration Cockpit in update mode for mass updates or use the released API_TECHNICALOBJECT_SRV to upload multilingual texts.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

use - I_ASSETHISTORYSHEETCUBE

then Subtotal on the basis of field - AssetAccountingSortedKeyFigure.

for Depreciation (Current year) use AssetAccountingSortedKeyFigure - 000012-0009790200.

Similarly use different key figure for rest other values.

Thanks

Gaurav Koundal

entry.title: How to leverage the SAP AI Core Service to use some powerful AI tools like Claude Code, Chat Wise
entry.content:
Our company is rolling out GitHub Copilot on a large scale. However, in real-world scenarios, a single coding assistant is rarely enough. Different agents shine in different use cases.

For example, in my own experience, Claude Code is far more powerful than GitHub Copilot when it comes to actual coding. It enables true Vibe Coding in a way Copilot simply can’t.

That said, compliance is always a priority at work. Even if you’ve purchased personal subscriptions, you can’t just use external models freely. This article will walk you through how to leverage company-provided AI models and integrate them into external AI tools.

 

Prerequisites

First, you’ll need to request an AI Core client ID and secret. One way is via the official request process, but you can also subscribe and deploy it yourself on BTP.

Apply url:

https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/IECOE/GAI02.08+Service+Now+User+Guideline#GAI02.08ServiceNowUserGuideline-HowtoRequestAPIaccessforSAPGenAIPlatform%28Playground%29 (see Appendix).

Once approved, you’ll receive credentials like this:

{
  "AICORE_AUTH_URL": "https://sapit-core-playground-vole.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_ID": "id",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET": "secret",
  "AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP": "1768f3f7-6c5b-45de-aeb8-xxxxxxx",
  "AICORE_BASE_URL": "https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2"
}

Our company supports nearly all mainstream models (GPT, Gemini, Sonet, etc.). The challenge is that SAP applies its own unique protocol layer, which makes these endpoints unusable directly with external tools.

To solve this, we need a proxy service that unwraps the SAP protocol and re-exposes it in OpenAI or Anthropic-compatible formats.

Thanks to Arch (EAS) and Xeric Wei, we already have such a proxy available: genaiproxy. It currently supports OpenAI and Anthropic. You can use it as is or fork it to extend for other protocols.

Setup

  • Python version: 3.13.6

  • Create config.json and key.json under config/ (see samples in repo).

  • Run proxy_service_v2.py to start the proxy.

By default, it runs at: http://127.0.0.1:9988

 

Example: Chatwise

Configure Chatwise with the following:

  • Anthropic

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic

    • API Key: your configured key (e.g. sk-kris)

  • OpenAI

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/openai/v1

    • API Key: your configured key

⚠️Note: SAP Core AI doesn’t yet support the response API format. GPT-5 still works, but only through a workaround.

Also, since SAP truncates model suffixes, you might want to hardcode the model name in your tool configuration.

Once set up, Chatwise works seamlessly — and the speed is excellent.

 

Example: Claude Code

Claude Code is widely regarded as one of the strongest agents for coding. Unlike GUI-based tools, it’s CLI-native, so it doesn’t require setting up an MCP server. It can do even more.

Installation is simple: Claude Code Docs.

To connect it with the proxy, configure your environment variables:

export ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic
export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN=sk-kris

That’s it. Enjoy the full power of Claude Code with your company’s AI Core.

 

Other tools like Cline work in a similar way.

With this setup, you can stay compliant, use company-provided AI Core services, and still enjoy the full ecosystem of modern AI coding agents.

entry.title: ‌🇳🇿‌ Webinar: Overview of Proposed Changes to New Zealand Leave
entry.content:
Join us for the session on upcoming legislative changes in New Zealand!

The Minister for Workplace Relations has unveiled a proposal to significantly overhaul the current Holidays Act.  It encompasses changes to almost every statutory leave type covered by that Act and will effect every employer and employee.  In this session, we will walk you through a high level of the proposed changes and outline the journey that still lies ahead before the legislation can be changed.  

Speaker: Katherine Truman, Product Manager, SAP

REGISTER HERE

If you want to get more information about the New Zealand Payroll topics provided by SAP experts, join the New Zealand Payroll - Human Capital Management Localization Work Zone group.
